data.headline: What recall means for S.F.’s stance on crime — and its status as a progressive bastion

San Francisco voters, many of whom embrace being labeled as progressive, decided they wanted a more traditional crime-fighter as district attorney and delivered what will be viewed nationally as a blow to efforts to reshape criminal justice.
D.A. Boudin was ousted in a historic recall. Here’s what happens next
Garofoli: S.F. voters got rid of Boudin — and may soon face a recall hangover

San Franciscans recalled district attorney Chesa Boudin but will wake up Wednesday with the same police department, the same prosecutors (for now), the same massive gap in income equality, the same housing affordability crisis, the same root causes of crime, and most important, the same mayor.
